aphorism: People will forget what you said, people will forget what you did, but people will never forget how you ruined their lives.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: It may seem a small thing to show someone you care but it can make a world of difference to them, so do it often, and from the heart.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: You are what you are when you're doing it. The rest of the time feel free to be yourself.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Don't wait for the sun to shine because it's out of your control.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: You can't lose what you never had.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: When you are a slave to, but not a master of your reality, when you the chosen and not the selector, it's time to give-up.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Have perspective. It's an important life skill to be able to differentiate between the things that matter and those which really don't.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Learn to embrace and accept the memories you still feel because they are part of who you now are.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Sometimes there are no answers, only futile questions because it is impossible to understand that which can never be understood.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Don't accomplish the opposite of what you really want by doing the thing that you're supposed to do.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: If you got what you wanted, you'd then want something else.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Find your own voice - don't be an echo of someone else.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: It is better to have no expectation yet be prepared than to expect and be unprepared.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Putting a smile on somebody's face is way easier than putting one on your own. If everyone made everyone else smile... what a world it'd be.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: I've learned to accept defeat but it's patience I just don't have time for.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: I recalled that the fall-off in illumination is proportional to the square of distance moved, that is why we hang lights in high rooms.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: It may well be dark and cold out there but today is still the first day of the rest of my life.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: I don't have a bad memory, i just conveniently forget.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: The struggle for the illusion of stability and certainty is the cause of much unhappiness in many lives.
author: Vijay Mahrra
tags: vijay twitter illusion stability life unhappiness 2010-05 2010-05-17

aphorism: Sometimes you will learn the right way by doing (or being forced to do) things the wrong way.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Stagnation is the enemy of innovation.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Seek to possess all you like but you can only ever really possess what is given to you.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: It's more believable when you show someone that you are happy than tell them that you are happy.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: If Jesus went up into the sky, shouldn't we all be looking for Jesus? #SETI
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Some people are like diamonds; forever bright, sharp, beautiful, attractive, hard, and yet flawed.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: It's not necessary to define what something is to enjoy it. Enjoyment of the undefined can be a wonderfully blissful experience.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: I believe that teaching people to think critically and philosophy are fundamental and should be a mandatory part of later school education.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Inside every thin person is a beautiful fat person waiting to get out.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: If the best way to make a friend is to be one, then the reverse must also hold true.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Disbelief is when things that only ever happen to other people, happen to you.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Sometimes you need to adopt tunnel-vision just to stay focused, get through the dark and reach the light at the end.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: The best way to be disappointed with people is to hold them to your own standards.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Look for inspiration when inspiration doesn't find you.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: If there's one thing I've learned, it's nothing.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: If you want to be sure about life, surround yourself with people who agree with you.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: It's definitely an advantage being me.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: In life, business, love and romance you really owe it to yourself to either try or fail trying.
author: Vijay Mahrra
tags: life business love romance vijinho twitter 2009-05-21 2009

aphorism: Everyone can understand your pain, and yet nobody else can feel it.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: You invade my thoughts like a mosquito I can't quite swat at night, buzzing around my ears, driving me crazy. I curse the day we met.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Nothing looks quite as interesting as it was the first time you saw it.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: You feel like the sun on my skin. You soothe like a breeze.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Sometimes your path is blocked by an immovable object that you can neither navigate around nor climb over. So you sit and contemplate...
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Life isn't easy because... you're the first person to live your life, it's never been done before by anyone else.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Sometimes in a relationship someone can have all of the right attributes and yet still be wrong for you.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: That which does not kill me makes me breakfast...
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: It's not necessary for things to be perfect, just that they work really well.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Sometimes it's more beneficial to think inside the box than outside of it.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Knowing what you know now, how would you do things again?
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: When an immovable object meets with an irrestible force sparks will fly.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Sometimes it's better to get carried away by the force of the river than to fight against the strong current.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: I can't accept that knowledge is power. Having knowledge is like masturbation. Having money is true power in this world.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: I'm such a fucking enigma that not even I can figure myself out!
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Bicycles are like people in that they have a history and personality.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: As long as you've got dreams that remain unfulfilled you've got a reason to live.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Some people just accept things as they are, others say "There's got to be a better way." And some people actually do something about it.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: You only reach maturity when you've stopped seeing the world in b&w & have learned to embrace & see its colour across many shades of grey.
author: Vijay Mahrra
tags: maturity blackandwhite grey gray vijay life twitter 2012-07 2012-07-01

aphorism: People will pay more for something with imperfections than much less for perfect.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Even when you know you'll lose, sometimes it's just better to have had the fun playing than to have avoided participating in the game.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Confidence, bravado, showmanship, misdirection, sleight-of-hand, it's hard to be a magician, but the effect of magic is priceless.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: A fleeting moment is better than no moment.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Looking back over my life it's funny how what seemed to be insurmountable mountains turned out to be just bumps in the road in hindsight.
author: Vijay Mahrra
tags: life mountains past hindsight vijay twitter 2012-08 2012-08-07

aphorism: In life there's little point in planning because life rarely turns out like you'd planned anyway.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Some people happily tread water, others choose to sink or swim. If not for drowning then just follow the current until you reach the sea.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: It's sad how the art of letter-writing and hand-written messages is more or less dead in this Internet age. Nothing is quite as personal.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Just realised rather late and from experience that unless you believe in yourself that you can, you'll never actually do it.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: How u choose to be when you wake up in the morning is your decision. U can choose to be in a good mood or a bad one but it's yours to make.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: There's nothing like a fresh sea-breeze to bring clarity, serenity and peace-of-mind.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Sometimes it's good to start your day with a leap-of-faith into the unknown.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: I'm always amazed that wherever I live I always meet good, great people who I'm proud to call my friends, for life.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: It's not so much "you make me laugh" as much as "I find you funny" but externalising is so common. "You make me angry!"?
author: Vijay Mahrra
tags: laughter funny emotion externalising vijay twitter 2012-10 2012-10-27

aphorism: Someone I just today met told me I'm always smiling. If they were me, they'd be smiling too.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Some people need happiness to get through life, other people rely on their misery.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Nobody likes being told that they've been doing something wrong their whole life, especially when it's true.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: If you're going to press with quotes from "an un-named source" you may as well quote my grandmother.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: The world would be a better place if people cared about others as much as they cared about their cars.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Laughter is the same in every language.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: It might take a little bit longer than most to get where I want but it's the journey,not the destination that provides the most joy in life.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: The key to failure is to not believe in the first place.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: It's difficult to spend more time worrying about things you can neither affect, influence nor change but many happily succeed in doing so.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Be not a fool but the smart one who fears the unknown, takes no risks, always chooses the safe option and lives a stable contented life.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Today I'm going to do something. I just don't know what it is.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Don't be fooled. There is another life and there is another way.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: The secret of happiness is to not let your head get turned...
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Human lives are so similar. We all go through the same shit, just in different ways.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: I have played my hand, dealt all of my cards. Beyond this point there is no looking or turning back. Only forwards and to the future.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: One can never have too much humour and passion in a relationship. I believe that without those one may as well become the living dead.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: I have just passed through a difficult phase and now today is the start of the rest of my life.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Resistance and resolve can become strong and harder to break from repeated exposure.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Swimming against the tide and hoping for driftwood to cling to is mostly futile but it's better than sinking or being swept away.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Thinking it's funny how so many people living for the weekend... when you're your own boss though every day feels like the weekend.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: If you live your dream, life is a fantasy.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Focus back to when you once did something silly/funny and smile/laugh to yourself about it. It's great to laugh at what fools we have been!
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: It's only acceptable to say "I wish I'd never had any children" if you can qualify it with a variation on "...but I love my children!"
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: In unexpected moments the unimagined passes. Therein can lie ugliness and/or beauty in life. We journey on until the next moment. Repeat.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: A friend Jacek: "You think you'll ever get married again?" Dad: "Son, only a moron sticks a fork in an electrical outlet more than one time."
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Being trapped can be good, especially when it's in a positive feedback loop because such moments are some of the best in life.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Mostly it's not the most technically-innovative theoretical invention/solution of a great mind that wins but rather the most practical one.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Unbound freedom is an attractive quality in a person so allow people to take liberties with oneself.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Every day is your last day so don't miss an opportunity to make someone laugh or smile even if the tomfoolery is at your own expense.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: There's no destination when you've already arrived at where you want to be.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: We will always have <insert word from memory here>.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: The thing about growing old is that you knoe when it's time to go home.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: It's fascinating to know world history, but it's wrong today to hold an entire group of people to account for something that they didn't do.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Every friend you have started out as a stranger.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: It's only when you force yourself out of your comfort zone that you realise the personal greatness that you are truly capable of achieving.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Space by itself can be quite beautiful and does not need to be 'filled', especially in one's own home.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Waits for no-one, eternal, can be limited but never enough, wish for another, the next, can be long or short, heals, flies and passes by.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: When seeds are planted and ideas are gestating, the birth can be complicated but the self must be free to express and advance itself.
author: Vijay Mahrra
tags: vijay life twitter 2010-03 2010-03-04 birth self ideas

aphorism: You can be the smartest cookie in the biscuit tin but there's a whole world of healthier, tastier snacks out there.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: It is the obsession with 'attaining' happiness that results in people feeling unhappy.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Being a good listener doesn't make it easy to understand your problems but of all of the people in your world I'm honoured that you chose to share them with me.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Your life's based on a true story.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Recent experience has led me to believe that life's greatest question is: "So, now what?"
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Things are often never simple so when they are actually simple one has a temptation to believe it is not so.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: It is not age but experience that makes one wiser.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: The clocks can go back but we can't.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: With opinions the ability to empathise and put oneself in another's shoes is no less valid than as having had direct personal experience.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: For as long as you live I can guarantee to you that there is yet another dish worth cooking that you've never ever cooked before.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: The only moment that exists in your life is now.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: One door closes, another one opens, that's life.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: The more we take things for granted, the less we care about them.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Human beings are the only life-form on Earth who will kill each other over an idea or belief.
author: Vijay Mahrra
tags: facebook vijay 2014-01-12 2014-01 life kill belief ideas

aphorism: Give stuff you don't use or need away. One less thing to own is one less thing to worry about.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Don't expect anyone to ever understand why you do the things that you do - if you wait for understanding and approval the moment will have gone. Applies as much to life as it does for street photography :)
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: It's more satisfying to do something because it's a challenge than because it's easy.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: How would the nationalists and the far-right treat the problem of how their genetic make-up came to be through history?
author: Vijay Mahrra
tags: facebook vijay 2014-02-15 2014-02 genetics history racism nationalism

aphorism: When all you see are possibilities it's easy to feel alive.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: "The right way" is the wrong way if it doesn't work.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: The thing that matters in a relationship is not what other people think, but what works.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Family are the people who care about you, not necessarily those who happen to have a similar genome.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: If you want to enslave someone, put them in debt.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: If I'd not spent so much of my life watching television I might have lived more.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: It's easier to say how someone did something wrong than how to do it right.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: A day doing what you want to do is a day less doing what you don't want to.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Being sick is like being in love - it's infrequent and hits you harder later in life.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: The older I get, the more clear the absurdity of modern life becomes.
author: Vijay Mahrra
tags: 2014-05 2014-05-17 absurdity life age maturity vijay facebook

aphorism: Fashion may come and go but style and class are permanent.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: You can never dig a hole for yourself so big that you can't dig yourself back out of it.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: If you envy others, there's an empty space in your life that needs filling.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Don't buy things because they're the best, buy things because they are useful.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: A statue in human form can be pleasing, even attractive to the eye, but never sexy because it is not alive.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Instead of trying to work around the limitations, work within them.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Never ever underestimate the incredibly amazing capacity for someone to shoot themself in the foot when things are going well.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Even if you think/feel that you live a meaningless life it's likely that your life means something to someone else.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Don't cycle after midday and before tea-time in a hot country.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Life's especially unfair to the people who aren't living.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Time spent freely in the service of others is never time wasted.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Just because you've been taught something doesn't mean that you've learned, much in the same way that just because you've heard someone doesn't mean that you've listened.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: A woman cannot speak for all women any more than a man can speak for all men.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: The less time you have left to live, the more precious it becomes, therefore older people should be paid more.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Creativity reveals itself most powerfully when it is operating within constraints.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: The problem isn't that there's not enough time and life's too short, it's sadly that we misuse it.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: In the distant future humanity evolved to such an extent that religion was diagnosed as a dangerous yet treatable mental illness.
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: To whoever says: "You're entitled to your own opinion." - Thank you for reminding me!
author: Vijay Mahrra

aphorism: Is everyday prejudice really shown through favouritism to a certain group of people or a person based on what we can infer about them?
author: Vijay Mahrra
